name: pg_ctl
description: initialize, start, stop, or control a PostgreSQL server
usage:
pg_ctl init[db]   [-D DATADIR] [-s] [-o OPTIONS]
pg_ctl start      [-D DATADIR] [-l FILENAME] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
                  [-o OPTIONS] [-p PATH] [-c]
pg_ctl stop       [-D DATADIR] [-m SHUTDOWN-MODE] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
pg_ctl restart    [-D DATADIR] [-m SHUTDOWN-MODE] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
                  [-o OPTIONS] [-c]
pg_ctl reload     [-D DATADIR] [-s]
pg_ctl status     [-D DATADIR]
pg_ctl promote    [-D DATADIR] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
pg_ctl logrotate  [-D DATADIR] [-s]
pg_ctl kill       SIGNALNAME PID

inheritedOptions.description: location of the database storage area

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: creates a new PostgreSQL database cluster

subcommands.name: start
subcommands.usage:
pg_ctl start [-D DATADIR] [-l FILENAME] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
             [-o OPTIONS] [-p PATH] [-c]

subcommands.name: stop
subcommands.description: shuts down the server that is running in the specified data directory

subcommands.name: restart
subcommands.description: effectively executes a stop followed by a start
subcommands.usage:
pg_ctl restart [-D DATADIR] [-m SHUTDOWN-MODE] [-W] [-t SECS] [-s]
               [-o OPTIONS] [-c]

subcommands.name: reload
subcommands.description: sends the postgres server process a SIGHUP signal

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: checks whether a server is running in the specified data directory

subcommands.name: promote
subcommands.description: commands the standby server to end standby mode and begin read-write operations

subcommands.name: kill
subcommands.description: sends a signal to a specified proces

tldr:
> Utility for controlling a PostgreSQL server and database cluster.
> More information: <https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/app-pg-ctl.html>.

- Initialize a new PostgreSQL database cluster:

`pg_ctl -D {{data_directory}} init`

- Start a PostgreSQL server:

`pg_ctl -D {{data_directory}} start`

- Stop a PostgreSQL server:

`pg_ctl -D {{data_directory}} stop`

- Restart a PostgreSQL server:

`pg_ctl -D {{data_directory}} restart`

- Reload the PostgreSQL server configuration:

`pg_ctl -D {{data_directory}} reload`
